Section 505 of the Trade Act of 1974 is amended to change the date from June 30, 1999, to June 30, 2004. The amendment applies to articles entered on or after the enactment date of the Act, with retroactive application for certain liquidations and reliquidations. Entries made after June 30, 1999, but before the enactment of this Act, can be liquidated or reliquidated duty-free. A request must be filed with the Customs Service within 180 days of the Act's enactment, providing necessary information for the process. To locate or reconstruct an entry, the Customs Service needs sufficient information provided within 180 days of the Act's enactment. SEC. 2. ENTRY PROCEDURES FOR FOREIGN TRADE ZONE OPERATIONS. The amendment to Section 484 of the Tariff Act of 1930 introduces a special rule for foreign trade zone operations, allowing for a single estimated entry or release of merchandise from the zone within a 7-day period. This entry or release is treated as a single entry for regulatory purposes. The Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985 sets fee exclusions and limitations for entry summaries in foreign trade zones. The Secretary of the Treasury may require electronic data interchange for filing entries and paying duties. The Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985 establishes fee exclusions and limitations for entry summaries in foreign trade zones. Merchandise must pay duties, fees, and taxes upon entry, and adequate controls must be in place to protect revenue and meet federal agency requirements. Exceptions apply to prohibited merchandise or items requiring entry summary before release from customs custody. Foreign trade zones are defined as zones established under the Foreign Trade Zones Act of 1934. The amendment to the Foreign Trade Zones Act will take effect 60 days after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. Modification of installment method and repeal of installment method for accrual method taxpayers. Modification of installment method for accrual basis taxpayers under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, where income from an installment sale is no longer accounted for using the installment method if it would be reported under an accrual method of accounting. The amendments made by this section modify pledge rules and conforming amendments in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, affecting installment obligations and sales occurring after the enactment of this Act.
